definitions:
The Act defines several key terms:
- 'Standard allowance' means the allowance to be included in an award of universal credit under section 9(1) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012
- 'LCWRA element' (Limited Capability for Work and Work-Related Activity element) as defined in regulation 27 of the Universal Credit Regulations 2013
- 'LCW element' (Limited Capability for Work element) as defined in regulation 27 of the Universal Credit Regulations 2013
- 'Pre-2026 claimant' - a claimant with LCWRA who was entitled to an award including the LCWRA element before 6 April 2026 and has been continuously entitled since
- 'Severe conditions criteria claimant' - a claimant with LCWRA where at least one descriptor from Schedule 7 constantly applies and will do so for life, arising from a diagnosed lifelong bodily disease/disablement or mental illness
- 'Consumer prices index' means the all items consumer prices index published by the Statistics Board
- 'Tax year' means the 12 months beginning with 6 April in any year
- 'Assessment period' has the same meaning as in Part 1 of the Welfare Reform Act 2012
obligations:
The Secretary of State must:
- Exercise relevant powers to secure that standard allowance amounts for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 meet minimum calculated amounts (Section 1)
- Exercise powers to increase the protected LCWRA amount or standard allowance where necessary to achieve required CPI-adjusted sums for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 (Section 4)
- Exercise powers to increase ESA IR disability premiums, support components, or personal allowances where necessary to achieve CPI-adjusted sums for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 (Section 5)
- The Department for Communities in Northern Ireland has corresponding obligations for Northern Ireland provisions (Schedule 2)
eligibility:
Eligibility criteria are established for different claimant categories:
- 'Pre-2026 claimant' eligibility: Must have been entitled to universal credit with LCWRA element before 6 April 2026 and continuously entitled since (with allowance for breaks due to financial conditions ending within 6 months)
- 'Severe conditions criteria claimant' eligibility: Must have limited capability for work and work-related activity, with at least one Schedule 7 descriptor constantly applying for life, arising from a diagnosed lifelong bodily disease/disablement (descriptors 1-8, 15a-b, 16a-b) or mental illness/disablement (descriptors 9-14, 15c-d, 16c-d), diagnosed by qualified healthcare professionals in NHS services
- Terminally ill claimants receive the protected (higher) LCWRA amount
payments:
Payment amounts are specified as follows:
- Standard allowance: Minimum amounts calculated by taking 2025-26 amounts (or previous year's Step 2 amounts), increasing by CPI percentage, then by uplift percentages: 2.3% (2026-27), 3.1% (2027-28), 4.0% (2028-29), 4.8% (2029-30)
- LCWRA element from 6 April 2026: Â£217.26 for new claimants (other than pre-2026 claimants, severe conditions criteria claimants, or terminally ill claimants)
- Protected LCWRA amount: Higher amount for pre-2026 claimants, severe conditions criteria claimants, and terminally ill claimants, maintained to ensure combined total with standard allowance increases by at least CPI each year
- LCWRA and LCW elements frozen (no annual up-rating) for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30
- ESA IR personal allowances increase by CPI plus uplift percentages
- ESA IR disability premiums, support component, and work-related activity component frozen, but protected to maintain CPI-adjusted combined totals
- Where joint claimants have different LCWRA element amounts, the higher amount applies
